speakers.bio: CEO of Web Summit. 1 of 7 billion.

title: Life with robots
description: We are not alone. Andra Keay will take us through the blended reality of an automated world

speakers.name: Andra Keay
speakers.bio: Andra Keay is the Managing Director of Silicon Valley Robotics, an industry group supporting the innovation and commercialization of robotics technologies. Andra is also founder of Robot Launchpad for startups, and cofounder of Robot Garden, a new robotics hackerspace. Andra is a core contributor to Robohub, the global site for news and views on robotics. She obtained her MA in Human-Robot Culture at the University of Sydney, Australia in 2011, building on a background as a robot geek, STEM educator and film-maker. Andra graduated as an ABC film, television and radio technician in 1986 and obtained a BA in Communication from the University of Technology, Sydney (UTS) Australia, in 1998.

title: From sports star to tech star
description: How does a successful career on the field prepare someone to lead a tech company? Three multi-award winning sports stars discuss.

speakers.name: Tiki Barber
speakers.bio: Tiki Barber is a founder and co-chairman of Thuzio, a company that provides brands and organizations with access to celebrity influencers through a comprehensive online software and service solution for talent procurement. He followed a successful on-field football career – highlighted by three Pro Bowl appearances and his spot atop the all-time rushing list for the New York Giants – with notable forays into media, including his current duties as host of a nationally syndicated morning show on CBS Sports Radio. Along with his degree from the University of Virginia, with a concentration in Management Information Systems, Barber brings a unique and valuable perspective to the topics of brand ambassadors and sports marketing.

speakers.name: Louis Saha
speakers.bio: Passionate about meeting people who want to change things positively but If it s for a chat only about it forget me.

speakers.name: Jamie Heaslip
speakers.bio: As professional off the pitch as on it, Jamie is involved in some ventures, the pride and joy being Bear restaurant in Dublin, as well as being actively involved in several charities both at home and abroad. He is a dedicated patron of GOAL, The Umbrella Foundation and the ISPCC as well as making the annual sacrifice of partaking in Movember; the male prostrate cancer awareness campaign.

speakers.name: Ian Prior
speakers.bio: Ian Prior has been Head of Sport at Guardian News and Media since 2013, responsible for sport content across all digital and print platforms. Previously he was sports editor of the Guardian and has worked for the paper since 1999.

Tasked with the responsibility of the global tech function across all of the company’s products, he’s here to let us in on a behind the scenes look of the largest newspaper across the US and how they’re managing digital media.

title: Motivation on and off the field

speakers.name: Matt Higgins
speakers.bio:
Matt Higgins serves as both the Vice Chairmen of the Miami Dolphins and the CEO of RSE Ventures.

In 2012, with co-founder Stephen Ross, he launched RSE Ventures, an international sports, entertainment and technology venture firm. As CEO, he has founded several successful companies including Ascendent Sports Group, Derris & Company and Catalyst Media. He is also one of the founders of the International Champions Cup, a global pre-season soccer tournament that was broadcasted to over 600 million households in 2014.

speakers.name: Curt Cronin
speakers.bio:
Over 16 years as a Navy SEAL, Curt deployed thirteen times and spent more than four years overseas. In that time, he honed his talent as a catalyst for transformation.

Curt’s passion is to engage each person, team or organization’s highest aspirations and help them connect to the hero within. He is an expert at maximizing human potential and synthesizing the strengths of a team to create unprecedented results in any context. His presentations address the art of leadership, organizational change for the information age, and the talent of harnessing your own courage and heroism to inspire and empower individuals and teams.

speakers.bio: Broadcaster and writer at the BBC

Harel Kodesh of GE will demonstrate how this looks in action....

speakers.bio: Kodesh joined GE from Nurego, where he served as chief executive officer and founder. Prior to starting Nurego in 2013, Kodesh served as executive vice president of EMC Corp.’s Cloud business and chief executive officer of Mozy, an EMC subsidiary. He also served as chief product officer of Amdocs from 2003 to 2008. He holds a Master of Science in electrical engineering from Technion – Israel Institute of Technology in Haifa, Israel.

title: Read all about it: the future of print
description: As the digital revolution of online media rolls on, print media has become overshadowed. Print may not be the future, but it's most certainly not the past. Our experienced panel at the forefront of this flux are here to discuss why we can't write it off just yet.

speakers.bio: Tanya Cordrey is Chief Digital Officer at Guardian News & Media, heading up  product, engineering, data and analytics.   Tanya previously worked at eBay, eToys,  BabyCenter.com and Zopa.com. Tanya is on the board of Schibsted Media Group.

speakers.bio: I'm the editor of Inc.

title: The parenting of creativity

speakers.name: Ben Jones
speakers.bio: Ben has built his global reputation as a technology innovator by delivering the seemingly impossible at the world’s most awarded digital agency. He has achieved this by creating a culture at AKQA that merges creativity and technology to ensure each idea and solution sets a new bar for the industry. Ben believes that the future of marketing will be defined by data and algorithms, delivering relevancy through augmented intelligence. He is currently spearheading AKQA’s thought leadership in this space. Ben is dedicated to developing ground-breaking experiences for some of the largest global brands: from hardworking eCommerce solutions and cutting-edge system integration to mobile and social media applications. Most recently, Ben and his team at AKQA have designed and developed one of the most intelligent websites in the world for Audi of America, and have defined and delivered the globally successful Nike Training Club app. Ben brings with him over 15 years’ experience in technology. Before joining AKQA he held senior technology management positions within KPMG Consulting, where he led their most innovative projects.

title: Head games: how concussion has impacted sport
description: On both sides of the Atlantic, concussion is becoming an every more thorny subject for all professional sports teams. We look at the impact it is having on professional sport.

speakers.name: Cindy Parlow Cone
speakers.bio: Cindy Parlow Cone, CEO of ImVere, played on the USA Women’s National Soccer Team,  amassing 75 goals, 35 assists, two Olympic gold and one silver medal, and one World Cup Championship in just 158 caps. Cindy’s international playing career was cut short at the age of 25, when she was 5th all-time leading scorer, due to post-concussion syndrome. Transitioning from playing to coaching, Cindy continued her winning ways by leading her team to a professional league championship in 2013, and added 4 collegiate championships to the 2 she won as a player. At the age of 35, she became the youngest coach to win an American professional championship in any sport. Due to her lingering issues with concussion and the fact that girls soccer is the second leading sport in concussion incidence (second only to football), Cindy has become a passionate advocate for solving sports’ concussion crisis.

speakers.name: Rod McLoughlin
speakers.bio: I am a sports medicine consultant specialising in the area of high performance medicine. Work with IIS and OCI

speakers.name: Anne-Marie Tomchak
speakers.bio: Anne-Marie Tomchak is an award winning digital journalist and world renowned social media expert. She currently leads the BBC’s social media coverage having launched BBC Trending in 2013 - a Webby winning team which prides itself on original journalism and creative storytelling.  Before BBC Trending, she was a regular face on BBC World News and produced the interview show HARDtalk. She has over a decade of national and international broadcasting experience and is a member of the advisory board for the Digital Youth Council of Ireland.

speakers.name: Andrew Morse
speakers.bio: Andrew Morse is Executive Vice President of Editorial for CNN U.S. and GM of CNN Digital Worldwide. He has oversight of the TV network's Domestic Newsgathering operations as well as the Washington Bureau and DC-based programming. In addition, Morse is responsible for CNN's global digital business, including editorial, product, technology, emerging platforms, business development and partnerships.

speakers.name: Aine Kerr
speakers.bio: Áine Kerr is Managing Editor @Storyful; the first social media news agency in the world. She was formerly Head of Content and Political Editor with the company. She is an experienced online and print journalist who covered Irish current affairs and politics for seven years with The Irish Times, The Irish Examiner and The Irish Independent. She is also an experienced media commentator on TV and radio and a lecturer in online journalism with Dublin Business School [DBS]. Aine has a Masters of Journalism with Dublin City University and a Bachelor of Education with St Patrick's College of Education.

speakers.name: Mary Spio
speakers.bio:
Mary is the founder of Next Galaxy Corp a leading content and technology solutions company creator of CEEKARS – the first 4D audio headphones for virtual reality and CEEK – a fully immersive social platform for accessing virtual reality experiences. Spio’s companies have created content and or technology for global titans including Microsoft XBOX, Coca Cola Company, Tribune News Company (Parent of LA Times, Chicago Times etc.), Emmis Communications, Billboard Awards, Lincoln-Ford and scores of iconic celebrities, retailers, radio station groups and much more.

Ms. Spio is an Innovation and entrepreneurship evangelist who works with the US Department of State in a global outreach program. Spio has spoken or visited countries including China, Mexico, Russia, Mexico, Pakistan, Ukraine, South Africa & more.
She is named alongside Oprah in NBC News’s 100 History makers in the making.

speakers.bio: Following his professional sports career, Akim was the founder and CEO of a technology company specializing in smart watches and wearable developments for the athletic and healthcare sector.

After graduating from The George Washington University with a bachelor's degree in political communication, Paucek founded Cerebellum Corporation, the company behind the award-winning educational Standard Deviants television program. Standard Deviants was distributed on over 100 PBS stations and was selected by TV Guide/Today Show as the top show for kids. After leading Cerebellum Corporation for a decade, Paucek co-managed the re-election campaign of U.S. Senator from Maryland, Barbara Mikulski and then returned to education as the CEO of Hooked on Phonics and expanded access to the program by bringing it from infomercial sales to distribution across major U.S. retailers.

Under his leadership, Optoro has expanded from a scrappy start-up to a major industry player, helping the nation’s top retailers address the $500B market of returned and excess goods. Tobin has been recognized as a leading SaaS CEO through honors such as Ernst & Young’s Entrepreneur of the Year and Washington Business Journal’s 40 under 40. Prior to launching Optoro in 2008, Tobin founded eSpot, one of the original eBay drop-off facilities, his first foray into the growing world of e-commerce. Tobin holds a B.A. from Brown University with a double major in Business Economics and American History.

speakers.name: Gary Bloom
speakers.bio:
Gary brings an exceptional background that includes more than two decades of successful leadership in enterprise software. Gary most recently was the CEO and president at eMeter, which provides smart grid management software for electric, gas, and water utilities. eMeter was recently acquired by Siemens Corporation. Prior to that, Gary was a consultant of TPG, a leading global private investment firm.
Gary was also the former vice chair and president of Symantec Corporation, where he led the company’s line of business organizations and the company’s corporate development efforts. Gary joined Symantec through the company’s merger with Veritas Software where he was the chairman and CEO. Before joining Veritas, Gary held senior executive positions at Oracle. During his 14-year career at Oracle, Gary led Oracle’s database business, worldwide marketing, support, education, and alliance organizations, and was responsible for mergers and acquisitions.
Gary earned his Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science from California Polytechnic State University San Luis Obispo, where he currently serves on the President’s Cabinet and the Board of the Cal Poly Foundation. He also serves on the board of directors of BMC Software and Turn.

title: M stands for messenger

speakers.name: David Marcus
speakers.bio:
David Marcus is the Vice President of Messaging Products at Facebook. He leads Messenger, which is used by hundreds of millions of people around the world. David joined Facebook in 2014 from PayPal where he spent the previous two years as the company’s President and previously as Vice President of Mobile, leading its mobile products and business. A lifelong entrepreneur, David launched his first two companies in Europe, the first at the age of 23. He moved to Silicon Valley in 2008 where he founded the mobile payments company Zong, which was acquired by PayPal in 2011. Born in France, David grew up in Paris and Geneva, and he taught himself to write computer code at age 8. He attended the University of Geneva for a year before dropping out to start his first company.  A lifelong entrepreneur and respected product innovator with an impressive record of business success on two continents, David Marcus joined PayPal in 2011 to continue working on his long-term vision of digital payment technology that delivers seamless, connected, and convenient experiences at scale.

Born in France, David grew up in Paris and Geneva, and he taught himself to write computer code at age 8. He attended the University of Geneva for a year before dropping out to start his career as an entrepreneur. His first startup was GTN, which he launched in in 1996 when he was 23. GTN grew to become one of Switzerlandâs top three alternative telecommunications carriers and it was acquired by World Access in 2000. He then started Echovox, a pan-European mobile media and entertainment company. Echovox served as the foundation for Zong, the company he created in 2008 after he moved to Silicon Valley. Zong introduced an entirely new way for consumers to pay quickly and easily by entering their mobile phone number and charging the payment to their wireless account.

In 2011, Zong was acquired by PayPal and David assumed the role of vice president of mobile, leading the companyâs mobile products and business, which included the development and launch of PayPal Here.

David was named PayPalâs president in April 2012. Driven by his belief that the essential foundation for business success is to understand everything through the eyes of customers, he is building on PayPalâs great scale, resources, and technological innovation to deliver products that delight customers and will revolutionize payments by reinventing the shopping experience for businesses and their customers around the globe.

He is an expert at maximizing human potential and synthesizing the strengths of a team to create unprecedented results in any context. His presentations address the art of leadership, organizational change for the information age, and the talent of harnessing your own courage and heroism to inspire and empower individuals and teams.

Previously she was Executive Chairman and a Partner at the advertising agency Karmarama, which she joined in April 2008. She has just stepped down as president of the IPA (the advertising industry trade body), the first woman president in its 96 year history.  Late in 2012 she was appointed Industry Chair of the Creative Industries Council a joint forum between the creative industries (including TV, computer games, fashion, music, arts, publishing, film and advertising) and Government. Prior to Karmarama, Nicola was the Deputy Chairman of Grey London and a Board Director at BBH.

In 2005 she featured in Management Today's list of the 'Top 35 Women Under 35’. In May 2011, Nicola was named an ‘International Woman to Watch’ by Advertising Age.  In the same year she was awarded as a CEW (Cosmetic Executive Women) Achiever of the Year.

In addition, Nicola is a Director of the Women’s Prize for Fiction and a Trustee of The White Ribbon Alliance.

Returning home to New York City two years later, he founded the non-profit organization charity: water in 2006. Turning his full attention to the global water crisis and the world's 800 million people without clean water to drink, he created public installations and innovative online fundraising platforms to spread international awareness of the issue. In seven years, with the help of more than 400,000 donors worldwide, charity: water has raised over $100 million and funded over 8,000 water projects in 20 countries. When completed, those projects will provide over three million people with clean, safe drinking water.Scott was recently recognized in Fortune Magazine’s 40 under 40 list, the Forbes Magazine Impact 30 list and was recently #10 in Fast Company’s 100 Most Creative People in Business Issue. He is currently a World Economic Forum Young Global Leader. Scott lives in New York City with his wife Viktoria.

Jain is the co-founder and CEO of Humin, a technology company in San Francisco working to make technology more human. Jain is also the founder and chairman of the Kairos Society, an organization of young entrepreneurs working to create billion-dollar solutions to the world challenges. Over the years, the Kairos Society has helped launch and grow over 100 innovative technology companies tackling problems in mobile healthcare, education, clean water, and more. 

Over the years Jain has been recognized for a variety of achievements. In 2010, Jain was selected as one of 80 students worldwide to participate in the Singularity University Graduate Studies Program, an interdisciplinary program based at the NASA Ames campus in Silicon Valley. Singularity University brings together leaders in business, science, and technology to facilitate the development of technologies that address humanity’s greatest challenges. He has been recognized as a Global Shaper by the World Economic Forum, a Leader del Futuro by the Ambrosetti Forum, and as a Young Global Leader by both the World Foresight Forum and the St. Petersberg International Economic Forum. In 2011, Inc. magazine named Ankur Jain the "Best Connected 21-Year-Old in the World" and awarded Jain "30 Under 30". In 2012, Jain was named “30 under 30: Solution Broker” by the Christian Science Monitor. In 2013, Jain was elected to the Innovation Board for the X-Prize Foundation. Entrepreneur

speakers.name: Aaron Skonnard
speakers.bio:
Aaron Skonnard is the CEO of Pluralsight, the leader in hardcore developer training. With Aaron's help, Pluralsight launched in 2004 with a small team of world-renowned software development authorities to provide professional training for developers throughout the world. The company launched a proprietary process whereby it publishes high-quality training videos through an unmatched online learning experience.

As CEO, Aaron focuses on Pluralsight's business strategy, future direction, product development, and strategic partnerships. On a day-to-day basis, Aaron works closely with the entire Pluralsight management team in a variety of capacities, including recruiting, brand management, marketing, sales, feature planning, and content acquisition.

Aaron comes from a strong technical background, and will always be a developer at heart, which helps keep him in tune with the Pluralsight community. Throughout his career, he's written hundreds of articles, several books, and was a long-time contributing editor to MSDN Magazine where he authored some popular technical columns for years. Aaron is a thought-leader in the industry and frequently speaks at industry events around the world.

After leading Cerebellum Corporation for a decade, Paucek co-managed the re-election campaign of U.S. Senator from Maryland, Barbara Mikulski and then returned to education as the CEO of Hooked on Phonics and expanded access to the program by bringing it from infomercial sales to distribution across major U.S. retailers.

Aaron Skonnard is the CEO of Pluralsight, the leader in hardcore developer training. With Aaron's help, Pluralsight launched in 2004 with a small team of world-renowned software development authorities to provide professional training for developers throughout the world. The company launched a proprietary process whereby it publishes high-quality training videos through an unmatched online learning experience.

As CEO, Aaron focuses on Pluralsight's business strategy, future direction, product development, and strategic partnerships. On a day-to-day basis, Aaron works closely with the entire Pluralsight management team in a variety of capacities, including recruiting, brand management, marketing, sales, feature planning, and content acquisition.

Aaron comes from a strong technical background, and will always be a developer at heart, which helps keep him in tune with the Pluralsight community. Throughout his career, he's written hundreds of articles, several books, and was a long-time contributing editor to MSDN Magazine where he authored some popular technical columns for years. Aaron is a thought-leader in the industry and frequently speaks at industry events around the world.

title: The future of lending?

speakers.name: Rob Frohwein
speakers.bio: Rob Frohwein is CEO and Co-Founder of Kabbage.  Prior to Kabbage, Rob was CEO of LAVA Group, Inc., an intellectual property and technology investment bank.  He is a magna cum laude graduate of Villanova Law School.

description: Design influences behaviour, from road signs to book covers, and now e-health. Jessica Greenwalt from Crowdmed and Omri Shohr from Medisafe share their findings on everything from purchases decisions to patient behaviour.

speakers.bio: Jessica Greenwalt is the Founder of Pixelkeet and Co-Founder of CrowdMed. She is one of Inc.'s "10 Women to Watch in Tech", Tech.co's "50 Women in Tech Dominating Silicon Valley", and Huffington Post's "6 Women Rocking Tech for Good

speakers.name: Omri Shor
speakers.bio: Omri Shor is the Co-founder and CEO of MediSafe

title: Talking business about security
description: Information security is a fact of life on the internet. With the rash of very public breaches, CEOs and boards members are posing a lot of questions to their technical staff. How should you talk to senior management and the board about security risk?

speakers.name: Chris Wysopal
speakers.bio: Chris Wysopal is Co-Founder, CTO and Chief Information Security Officer at Veracode, which he co-founded in 2006. He oversees technology strategy and information security. He is the author of the book, "The Art of Software Security Testing".

title: The hackable home
description: How much does a smart home know about you? While looking at the benefits of a smart home our panel will address the concerns and discuss the importance of a secure home network.

description: Entrepreneurs take risks, create things we didn't even know we needed and fundamentally change the world we live in. The rock stars of the tech world are characters who transcend their creations and take on almost god like statuses. Our panelists take on the narrative of the entrepreneur in our contemporary world and chat about what it takes to craft a leader with purpose, personality and power.

speakers.bio: CEO at Orson & Co - Redefining storytelling and longform narrative for mobile.

speakers.bio: Anne-Marie Tomchak is an award winning digital journalist and world renowned social media expert. She currently leads the BBC’s social media coverage having launched BBC Trending in 2013 - a Webby winning team which prides itself on original journalism and creative storytelling.  Before BBC Trending, she was a regular face on BBC World News and produced the interview show HARDtalk. She has over a decade of national and international broadcasting experience and is a member of the advisory board for the Digital Youth Council of Ireland.

title: Bitcoin state of play with Gavin Andresen
description: From rumoured bans to booms, 2015 was big for bitcoin worldwide. In the midst of continued global economic instability, what role does a decentralized crypto currency now play in powering the next wave of economic growth?

speakers.name: Gavin Andresen
speakers.bio: Gavin Andresen serves as the Chief Scientist and Director of Bitcoin Foundation. Mr. Andresen began his career working on 3D graphics software at Silicon Graphics Computer Systems. Since leaving the Silicon Valley, his positions included Chief Technology Officer of an early voice-over-the-Internet startup and co-founder of a company making multiplayer online games for blind people and their sighted friends. He is the lead developer for the Bitcoin digital currency project.

speakers.bio:
He founded the first patented prediction market, and has just closed on a $1.6M equity crowdfunding round for his Bitcoin Capital fund.
Max Keiser - CEO & co-founder of StartJOIN and StartCOIN. He is one of the world's most vocal advocates, early adopter, and investor in Bitcoin and Bitcoin startups such as BitPay, The Keiser Report airs to millions on RT, providing world class financial news and analysis and was the first major media outlet to cover bitcoin and crypto currencies. He founded the first patented prediction market, the Hollywood Stock Exchange, invented the first patented virtual market-making technology and currency, and he's the co-founder of Bitcoin Capital. @maxkeiser

speakers.bio: Dr. Ed Catmull is a co-founder of Pixar Animation Studios and President of Walt Disney Studios. He has been honoured with five Academy Awards, and an award for his lifetime of technical contributions and leadership in the field of computer graphics for the motion picture industry.
